verses.text: Hear ye this, O priests; And hearken, ye house of Israel; And give ye ear, O house of the king; For judgment \add is\add* toward you, Because ye have been a snare on Mizpah, And a net spread upon Tabor.
And the revolters are profound to make slaughter, Though I \add have been\add* a rebuker of them all.
I know Ephraim, and Israel is not hid from me: For now, O Ephraim, thou committest whoredom, \add and\add* Israel is defiled.
They will not frame their doings to turn unto their God: For the spirit of whoredoms \add is\add* in the midst of them, And they have not known the \sc Lord\sc*.
And the pride of Israel doth testify to his face: Therefore shall Israel and Ephraim fall in their iniquity; Judah also shall fall with them.
They shall go with their flocks and with their herds to seek the \sc Lord\sc*; But they shall not find \add him;\add* he hath withdrawn himself from them.
They have dealt treacherously against the \sc Lord\sc*: For they have begotten strange children: Now shall a month devour them with their portions.
Blow ye the cornet in Gibeah, \add And\add* the trumpet in Ramah: Cry aloud \add at\add* Beth-aven, After thee, O Benjamin.
Ephraim shall be desolate in the day of rebuke: Among the tribes of Israel have I made known that which shall surely be.
The princes of Judah were like them that remove the bound: \add Therefore\add* I will pour out my wrath upon them like water.
Ephraim \add is\add* oppressed \add and\add* broken in judgment, Because he willingly walked after the commandment.
Therefore \add will\add* I \add be\add* unto Ephraim as a moth, And to the house of Judah as rottenness.
When Ephraim saw his sickness, And Judah \add saw\add* his wound, Then went Ephraim to the Assyrian, And sent to king Jareb: Yet could he not heal you, Nor cure you of your wound.
For I \add will be\add* unto Ephraim as a lion, And as a young lion to the house of Judah: I, \add even\add* I, will tear and go away; I will take away, and none shall rescue \add him\add*.
I will go \add and\add* return to my place, Till they acknowledge their offence, and seek my face: In their affliction they will seek me early.
